reviewText: Lichtspielhaus is an amazing assortment of footage from an outstanding (my favorite) band, Rammstein! For such a small price (I only paid $10!) you will get a dvd that features 12 music videos, the making of 5 music videos, 6 live concert highlights, and 4 commercials.Rammsteins' music videos are outstanding, when you watch them you can really see how much thought the band puts into making them, and they truly are pieces of art. The music videos that you get are:1. Du Riechst So Gut2. Seemann3. Rammstein4. Engel5. Du Hast6. Du Riechst So Gut 98'7. Stripped8. Sonne9. Links 2-3-410. Ich Will11. Mutter12. Feuer FreiThen you get videos that document the making of 5 of the music videos, these are really interesting to watch, they give you insight into how each video was conceived and made, and they feature members of Rammstein discussing the videos too! The making of videos that you get are:1. Du Hast2. Du Riechst So Gut 98'3. Sonne4. Links 2-3-45. Ich WillThe best part of the Lichtspielhaus dvd (in my opinion) is the live concert footage that you get. It is really amazing to watch Rammstein perform in front of only a few hundred people in 1996, and then perform in front of thousands within a few years, and yet they still put so much energy into their performance regardless of the crowd's size, it just goes to show you how serious Rammstein is when it comes to performing on stage. The live concert footage you get is:1. 100 Jahre Rammstein, Arena Berlin 1996. The songs they perform are Herzeleid and Seemann.2.  Philipshalle, Düsseldorf 1997. The song they perform is Spiel Mit Mir.3. Rock AM Ring Festival, 1998. The songs they perform are Heirate Mich and Du Hast.4.Live Aus Berlin, Wuhlheide 1998. The song they perform is Sehnsucht.5. Big Day Out Festival, Sydney 2001. The songs they perform are Weißes Fleisch and Asche Zu Asche.6. Velodrom, Berlin 2001. The songs they perform are Ich Will and Links 2-3-4.Lastly you get some German tv commercials, they are advertising Rammsteins' newest album/song, and there is also a clip that features random news footage of the reaction different countries had to Rammstein when they started out, they were really fun to watch. The commercials that you get are:1. Du Hast2. Links 2-3-43. Mutter4. Achtung Blitzkrieg!Lichtspielhaus was such a great purchase, it features so much amazing footage from Rammstein, that paying only $10 feels like I am ripping off the band! If you are a Rammstein fan this is a much have, it is more than reasonably priced, and the amount of stuff that you get on Lichtspielhaus is priceless!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: As an American who's a fan of the German band Rammstein, it's near impossible to get quality copies of their collection of videos and to see their concert performances.  Live Aus Berlin was a great taste of their live show, Lichtspielhaus however gives you all of their videos throughout the entire span of their career so far, at an incredibly low price also!Where to start however?  It's simply amazing, there videos are simply amazing and ground breaking.  The imagery in some of them is incredible considering how they're just a rock group (don't get me wrong here, rock groups just aren't really known for their inspiring videos).  The interviews with the memebers were great, its not that often you get to see interviews with them to be honest.  Plus all the concert footage.The only real problem I had with this was that I found the menu to be a bit hard to navigate through, but it could ahve been a lot worse.So go out and buy this...NOW!!!!
summary: If you like Rammstein, why don't you already own this?!?!?!

reviewerName: Bartok Kinski "A casual stroll through the lu...
reviewText: I guess I'll be the first one who goes against the masses here since I actually have musical tastes beyond blind adoration or intoxicated fan worship.I rented Rammstein - Lichtspielhaus to see how corny this band that I've heard so much about was. And they're pretty corny.The Rammstein DVD is a collection of stereotyped, cliched, and commonplace metal videos from the mildewed and overhyped German metal band, Rammstein.The band's entire collection of promotional music videos, about 5 vapid, drained, and exhausted songs is all you get.All of the videos are directed by some standard film geek German doofus, as you get to see the useless, "making of" sections which were created for about 4 of the lousy videos. There's so much self-aggrandizement that I skipped this section entirely.You also get "live concert" highlights from debilitated performances in Düsseldorf, Berlin, and various money grabbing festivals except these have been "cleaned up" and edited so heavily that it just sounds like a fake "live concert".That's all you get folks, which is basically 'nothing'. Save your money.

reviewText: This is a truly remarkable band. Their musical abilities are unquestionable; their creativity oustanding; their themes: at times playful, at times macabre, and probably offensive to some. Their can be consider pansexual; as there are subtle homosexual undertones and some of their songs clearly address violent pedophilia, not necessarily as perpetrators but more likely as social critics; as they invoke other themes, in lyrics and customes, they note other social ills. Their videos are visually compelling with great color, dynamism and the music is rythmic, vibrant, and loud.The DVD offered 5:1 setup that didn't work.

reviewText: This is one of the best produced music dvds you can find. A+ all around, and the best part is that it's dirt cheap! Rammstein is one of the very few worthy mainstream artists around. No one can touch them. It's about time that a band becomes big in America simply because they are good! And they don't even sing in English. They stand in stark contrast to all the nu metal feces that the mindless masses gobble without a thought, with their early 90's style Martial Industrial Metal shaded with Gothic melodrama. They're also one of the most visually stunning and theatrical bands since KISS. There may be hope yet.

It has excellent quality videos, well filmed live concert footage, commentary, making-of clips and more. If you like Rammstein at all, this is a must have. And the price is one of the best bargains known to mankind.

reviewerName: Der Hammer des Kuchens "I guess so"
reviewText: This dvd is amazing just simply amazing. In fact I can't even describe it to you but I will try.Let's start things off with the videos. The first couple of videos are pretty lame but that's to be expected. The videos start to get good with Engel and they just keep on getting better until their last video Feuer Frei. Most of the videos all have a plot like a little movie which I enjoyed because you don't see many videos like that in America. The videos also had some funny moments in them like in Sonne and ich will. The video Mutter didn't make sense at all but it's unintentionally funny.The concert footage was also very good. It starts off by showing Rammstein performing on a small stage in 1996 all the way to them performing in arenas in 2002. It's a nice way to see how they've evolved from their beggining to the present. There is footage from 6 different concerts. In 4 of them they play 2 songs and on 2 of them they play one song. The footage with sehnsucht on it is taken from the dvd Live aus Berlin and the studio version is heard. You also don't get to see that much pyrotechnics but there is some, not that they really need it to throw a good show.The extras include interviews with subtitles which are okay to watch every now and then. They also include footage of Rammstein appearing on all of the MTV's from America to Germany spanning their career, which I like to watch a lot more than the interviews.This is a great dvd at a very cheap price and I would recommend that you buy now if you're a Rammstein fan.
Title: N/A

reviewText: oh boy where to start? this dvd is simply amazing. it's how you should do a dvd except for the menu but it's only a minor iritation and does not detract from the goods whatsoever. so what are the goods? 3 and a half hours of 100% pure rammsteiny deutsch goodness. you get all of their videos except for "das modell" which they absolutely hated. now the majority of these videos haven't been seen in the u.s. on tv before and it's pretty much something you'd want to buy just to see. the audio and video are fantastic, especially for those who use a ps2, if you always use the +2 volume for dvds, you'll have to turn it down to the standard as the volume is that good...i mean just watching to the "rammstein" damn near blew out my speakers.for the videos...you get these:"du reischt so gut"-the original version that is pretty much a live version of the 'herzeleid' album cover."seemann"-a great video that somewhat plays with the lyrics correctly. the video is beautiful and it never gets old. it shows the till on a boat with the band dragging it through sand with shots of a woman walking alone."rammstein"-this is not the 'lost highway' edit of the song, but the full version from 'herzeleid'. its footage of them playing live from the '100 jahre rammstein' performance with clips of 'lost highway' throughout."engel"-the first venture into the tarentino inspired video realm. its their version of 'from dusk till dawn'."du hast"-the song that got them noticed in the states. this version has some new stuff that wasn't shown on mtv. still classic."du reischst so gut '98"-a new revamped version that involved werewolves and richard wearing a dress. something worth seeing."stripped"-previously only visable on the "live aus berlin" dvd. it's footage of past olympics and stuff. it contains some of the most beautiful shots i've ever seen (the massive amount of women doing that arm fanning thing...wow)."sonne"-their rendition of snow white rammstein style."links 2-3-4"- the video about ants hehe."ich will"-a sequel of sorts to 'du hast'. it's them robbing a bank for the fame."mutter"-now this one is hard to explain...all i can is...there are 2 till's."freur frei!"-them playing live with clips from 'XXX' in it.now the making of the videos give great insight into what rammstein is and how some of the videos were made. its nice to see them in pure deutsch and not overdubbed in english. for me, the german language is beautiful and cool sounding and thats what gives rammstein such a unique edge.the live footage is also amazing and you get the following:100 jahre rammstein: 'herzeleid' and 'seemann' live. 'seemann' is great here in this performance.philipshalle: 'spiel mit mir'rock am ring: 'heirate mich' and 'du hast'. this pretty much stripped down rammstein minus the telephone and pyro for 'du hast'. they can still put on a great show minus it.live aus berlin: 'sehnsucht'...now this is not the live version from 'live aus'. its more the album version with the crowd screaming along and you can sorta hear the pyro going off during it. its a bit odd cuz i miss the crow singing along.big day out: 'weisses fleisch' and 'asche'. man, this one is great. its one of my favorites.velodrom: 'ich will' and 'links'. this is also another favorite. 'links' is amazing here. also, i think this version of 'ich will' is perhaps the same live version on the 'ich will' single.there are even trailers for 'du hast', 'mutter (the album)' and 'links 234' along with the 6minute "achtung blitzkrieg!" now what the hell thats a trailer for i don't know. but it's a quick retrospective on the history of rammstein. if someone knows whats the deal with this...please tell me hehe.but with all this amazing good stuff...theres one down side. the menus. visually, it is amazing. as for how to use them, kinda slow. on some dvd players, it won't go anywhere. but it's nice to know that they included a warning about this in the booklet in the case.all in all this is a fantastic dvd and more bands should do more dvd's just like this because it's something thats amazing and the replay value is virtually endless (i've seen it god knows how many times and i'm not sick of it yet).
summary: now that's what i call entertainment!

reviewerName: JT "I wear my pants backwards and on fire, ju...
reviewText: Lichtspeilhaus is the quintesential video archive of Rammstein prior to their Reise, Reise and Rosenrot albums. It kicks major butt! Among my favorites are the Tarantino-esque DU HAST video which reminds me of Pulp Fiction, with an awesome shot of a guy on fire walking around in slow motion. It's so beautiful you can't look away, even in the making of featurette of German gangster-style video, no one told the stuntman when to stop because of how entrancing it was. The guy eventually dumped himself in the kiddie pool after his suit got uncomfortably hot when the director failed to say cut.Among the many creative videos, Seeman is the most powerful and moving as both the video and in the live footage. The song is so beautiful you can see some people crying in the live footage as they sing along.Another more interesting video was SONNE in which Rammstein is the Seven Dwarfs digging up gold to be sniffed up like cocaine for Snow White. Then there's that epic shot of Richard Z. Kruspe with that Gigantic guitar.My all time favorite is DU RIESCHT SO GUT '98, is which the band becomes werewolfs hunting down this rather beautiful gal in a red dress. Then Till Lindemann turns into a wolf creature comprised of all six wolves as one. Then the funniest moment is where Richard walks into the ballroom wearing a dress.In all, this is an absolute must-have for any Rammstein fan! But I still like ICH WILL, where Flake (pronounced Flak-uh, the band's master keyboardist) is sitting in the bank with a huge bomb vest.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Rammstein's "Lichtspeilhaus" is one of the best music DVD's I've come across. I was surprised to see that not only does this DVD have them playing live, but it also includes all of their PVs- and the "making of's" for five of the videos. I have to say that the content of the DVD is incredible and the interviews are interesting, There's quite a lot with the band (Yay!) and what the directors say are interesting enough. Entertaining bit in the making of "Du Hast" where Till tells about their experiences with fire... most amusing (and painful sounding). The concerts are on fire- literally; I've never seen such large explosions on stage, it's thrilling, and includes such lovely moments as in the live version of "Heirate Mich" where Till walks around on his knees pawing at the guitarists and pleading "Heirate Mich?" (Marry Me). Of course I have to mention that the DVD menu is a bit long (and difficult!), but I suppose it only helps to build up one's anticipation. Also it freezes up sometimes and gives you codes to move faster (they sort of work). Anyway, it's a good buy- well worth it- especially for fans (it's only $11!). I wouldn't recommend this video for the sheltered though (or those who are younger because of the explicit content), only those who really like gothic music and can stand the disturbing images (and pyrotechnics) contained in the DVD. Ho Ho, Let's Go!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Rammstein's blend of pounding industrial music and horror theatrics is on full display in this, the second DVD the band has put out.  The first, "Live Aus Berlin" detailed an amazing live show in Berlin.  "Lichtspielhaus" is more a compilation of selected shows and videos that serves as the perfect introduction to people wanting to get into Rammstein's music.VIDEOS: All 12 of Rammstein's videos are included in all their stunning imagery.  Rammstein's doom and gloom music has always been best suited for the visual and these videos are all amazing.  The highlight of the bunch has to be the gothic-tinged 1998 version of "Du Riechst So Gut", one of the best horror-themed music videos ever.MAKING OF: A section detailing the making of 5 selected music videos.  Details the production efforts of those involved in the making of the videos.  Throughout, many commentaries are included and we get to learn lots about the band, its history, the philosophies behind their music.  The most educational of the sections.LIVE:  Live footage selected from 6 of their concerts throughout Germany and Australia.  All 6 concerts cover 2 songs a piece.  This is probably the best way to witness Rammstein's evolution; the first concert in 1996 has rather humble stage histrionics.  By the time the 4th concert rolls around, Rammstein's high-tech gadgets are on full display, such as the singer's lazer eye, fire boots and enough explosions and fire to alert the national guard.  The adoration that the german crowd (who are incredibly diverse in age) have for their national heroes is remarkable, they all seem to know the lyrics for every song, most evident when they sing along to the haunting "Seamann".The videos and Making of sections are great but it's the live footage that sent me into a couch-jumping, pillow-throwing frenzy.  Rammstein are simply put the most amazing live band in existence at the current time.  Apparently, almost everyone in Germany listens to them, people of all different ages and interests.  It's a pretty cool band to have as a nation's musical pride, especially considering I live in a country where the national pride is Céline Dion.  This is an incredible package for fans of the band, delivering all the goodies in a massive 210 minute filler-free DVD.  I'd never come across such a quality DVD at this type of bargain bin price before.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Rammstein's videos are just as bizarre and wonderful as their live shows, and LICHTSPIELHAUS is the perfect DVD for any Rammstein fan. Encapsulating most of their videos (minus the ones from REISE, REISE and ROSENROT), this is a stellar collection. Here's a breakdown of the DVD itself:MENU: My god, the technology they have come up with is absolutely amazing on the menus. It's sort of like a 3-D environment with a odd and strange structure housing the features you can choose from. Whether you want to view the music videos or the live footage, you can't go wrong with the way they set up this menu. Definitely hands down one of the best I've ever seen.THE MUSIC VIDEOS: Now this is really the meat of the DVD. You get all the videos from HERZELEID, SEHNSUCHT, and MUTTER. You will surely find so much to enjoy here, and whether you want to view the videos of "Seamann", "Rammstein", or even "Du Hast", you're going to be impressed. When it comes down to it, the music videos will grab you by the shirt collar and never let you go. The video for "Du Reichst So Gut" is both strange and funny. Definitely the best part of the DVD.THE LIVE FOOTAGE: Ah, now we all know how much of a show these guys can put on. From Till setting himself on fire to the crowd chanting "Rammstein! RAMMSTEIN!", you'll find plenty to enjoy. Even though it isn't as much as you'll find on the stellar LIVE AUS BERLIN DVD, you're going to really enjoy the footage, and the band's performance is by far one of the best on the stage.OVERALL IMPRESSION: LICHTSPIELHAUS is a terrific DVD for the Rammstein fan. While I eagerly await the second volume of music videos and live footage to be released hopefully next year, you'll find so much to enjoy on this collection. If I could give this two thumbs up, I'd definitely do it. But for now, a five star rating is the closest justice I can give this phenomenal DVD set. Rammstein fans, eat up and enjoy!

Title: N/A

reviewText: At long last, American Rammstein fans who aren't net-savvy enough to download videos have the whole R+ video catalog at their fingertips with "Lichtspielhaus."  As a fairly new Rammstein fan, I was anticipating this DVD avidly because I'd never seen any of the videos, and it definitely did not disappoint.  I'd heard about the various videos, most notably "Du Hast" and "Ich Will," but even the straight performance videos have a nice edge to them.  In addition to the videos, there's also a couple of hours worth of "the making of" various videos and live clips from shows around the world.  On the live menu, only the shows are listed, not the songs that will be performed, so it's a bit of a surprise bag.  Fans will note that there is a clip from "Live Aus Berlin," which was released on DVD here a couple of years ago, but it's actually treated as more of a performance video, as the song performed is taken straight from the CD!  And, being a red-blooded heterosexual woman, all the excellent shots of a shirtless, greased-up Till Lindemann automatically add stars to my rating, heh heh.Diehard fans will do a bit of nitpicking--it was heavily rumored that "Lichtspielhaus" would contain the video for Rammstein's cover of Kraftwerk's "Das Modell," but it doesn't, nor does it contain a live video of the infamous stage working of "Buck Dich" that got Till and Flake Lorenz arrested a few years ago.  I had some difficulty in getting to the section that allowed you to add English subtitles (a must if you want to view "the making of" section and don't speak German), but that was my only complaint.  Otherwise, it's an excellent investment for Rammstein fans, not to mention a great value.  Even if you've seen the videos over the net, you'll find "Lichtspielhaus" light years ahead in quality--and it'll keep your appetite whetted for the new CD that should come out this year.

reviewText: Given the hopeless, vapid emptiness of MTV and the American music scene in general, it is difficult to find cool material especially when it comes to foreign bands. Well that's why they make DVDs like this one. As you should know if you're reading this, Rammstein makes ultra-forceful metal that is both heavy and creative... a difficult feat to say the least. Well their videos will not disappoint you. Nearly all of the pieces contained herein are solid representations of the band. They also give you something that other bands never do anymore - videos that actually have great concepts and captivating storylines... we haven't seen much of that since the 80's. I have to totally object to another reviewer's opinion that "Sonne" was a low point; are you nuts? That is one of the most creative clips ever made... I refuse to give it away since it's such a nice surprise. One critique... the menus are a bit awkward to navigate. Anyway, if you like this band or just hard-as-nails music then get this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Rammstein has done it again with this wicked awesome DVD! It features all of their breakthrough videos "Du Riechst So Gut" to "Mutter." So just that makes it a must have for any Rammstein fan. It also features "making of" documentaries of selected videos: Du Hast, Du Riechst So Gut, Links 2-3-4, Sonne, and Ich Will.The live performances are truly amazing. The video clips taken from various performances from Rammstein's career show the evolution and the awesomeness of this truly wonderful band. The performance of "Seemann" and the Big Day Out clip are the most memorable.The only downside to the DVD is the lack of live performances that aren't already featured in the music video section. The menus are cool and the interviews are a real treat. The sound quality is awesome, but the DVD is not in 5.1 surround if you're into that sort of thing. I highly recommend this DVD and I say it's a must have if you're a Rammstein fan.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Rammstein has set the standard by which all future music DVDs will be measured. You get all their videos, some interesting interviews, and even a selection of live concert footage from shows other than their massive "Live Aus Berlin" project.The sound and video quality are uniformly excellent. The production overall is terrific. My one issue is the somewhat annoying menu system. It's pretty cool the first few times you look at the DVD, but later when you just want to get to a specific video, you have to wait around for lengthy animations and such. It just takes a while to navigate. This is, however, a small complaint.The sound and video quality of the live material is not quite as good. It looks more like a document of the show rather than an intentional DVD shooting. The camera is a bit shaky at times and the audio is not amazing. This doesn't really affect things all that much though - the power of their live performances comes through crystal clear.Every Rammstein fan needs to buy this DVD immediately. If you're new to Rammstein, this is a great place to start. They have a lot of great videos and the concert footage will give you an excellent idea of what their live shows are live. You'll find many hours of tranzmetal enjoyment here. Lets hope they eventually release a "Lichtspielhaus 2" with their latest videos!
summary: Essential viewing for all Rammstein fans

reviewText: I've loved Rammstein for years and like many fans find them a bit ellusive. Interviews are hard to come by, the band doesn't divulge their personal information, and for the most part they're clothed in secrecy. "Lichtspielhaus" lets you see another side of the band that you don't normally see. In their making the videos section, you see senses of humor come out from the band members. You see them tease each other, make jokes, and otherwise act like the opposite of the robotic, stoic creatures they appear to be normally. Interviews are a real mouthful and too lengthy...it seems impossible for a German to give a simple yes or no answer, and the DVD menu is a real challenge to navigate. Other than that, this is the DVD Rammstein fans have been waiting for.
Title: N/A
